alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:48AM EST until January 11 at 2:18AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Pottstown affecting Montgomery County. For the Schuylkill River...including Pottstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Pottstown. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Sewers in the Pottstown area, due to high and backwater effects, begin to flood. At 12.5 feet, Portions of PA Route 724 along the Berks/Chester county line begin to flood, specifically Union Township in Berks county and North Coventry Township in Chester county. At 13.0 feet, Portions of PA Route 724 along the Berks/Chester county line are closed due to high water, specifically Union Township in Berks county and North Coventry Township in Chester county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 10/20/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Pottstown 12.5 11.6 Wed 6 am 9.0 6.8 14.4 1pm 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
